net.sf.opengroove.client.example
Class ExampleChatWorkspace

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.opengroove.client.workspace.Workspace
      net.sf.opengroove.client.example.ExampleChatWorkspace
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ExampleChatWorkspace
extends Workspace

simple chat workspace, intended as an example. when activated, it shows a JFrame that contains a textarea (non-editable) and a text field. you type in the text field, then hit enter, and your chat message is sent to all online members of the workspace. when a chat message is received, it shows up in the text area. whenever you restart OpenGroove, the text area is cleared (meaning that it stores the current chat info in memory). it has one configuration

Author:
Alexander Boyd
See Also:

Method Detail

configurationCancelled

public void configurationCancelled()
Description copied from class: Workspace
NOT USED RIGHT NOW. when used, this method will be called when the cancel button is clicked in the configuration window. the configuration window doesn't have a cancel button right now, so this method is unused.

Specified by:
configurationCancelled in class Workspace

configurationSaved

public void configurationSaved()
Description copied from class: Workspace
indicates that the user clicked the OK button in the configuration window. settings in the JComponents returned from getConfigurationComponents should be saved.

Specified by:
configurationSaved in class Workspace

getConfigurationComponents

public Map<String,JComponent> getConfigurationComponents()
Description copied from class: Workspace
gets the configuration tabs that should be added to the configuration window, in addition to the default tab. the key of each entry is the name of the tab to show and the value is the JComponent (usually a JPanel) to show inside the tabbed pane, when the tab is shown.

Specified by:
getConfigurationComponents in class Workspace
Returns:

initialize

public void initialize()
Description copied from class: Workspace
initializes this workspace. this is called for each workspace that the user is a member of when the user runs OpenGroove. if this method throws an exception, the exception will be printed to stderr, but the workspace will continue to be used.

Specified by:
initialize in class Workspace

receives a message from another user that uses this workspace.

userStatusChanged

public void userStatusChanged()
Description copied from class: Workspace
indicates that a user has signed on or off. the user may not be a member of this workspace, so no changes may have actually occured that concern this workspace.

Specified by:
userStatusChanged in class Workspace

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Description copied from class: Workspace
shuts down this workspace. there is no guarantee that this will be called, in particular, if OpenGroove exits as a result of the computer shutting down, then this will not be called. it is only guaranteed that it will be called if the workspace is to be shut down but the vm will continue running, such as if the workspace is deleted.

Specified by:
shutdown in class Workspace
